intro: Parsonsia densiflora, commonly known as the dense-flowered parsonsia, is a flowering plant native to tropical regions of Australia. It belongs to the Apocynaceae family and is characterized by its striking, showy flowers that range in color from yellow to orange. The plant typically grows as a shrub or small tree, reaching heights of up to 3 meters. Its leaves are opposite, ovate, and often have a waxy texture, while its flowers are clustered in dense inflorescences. Parsonsia densiflora is adapted to arid and semi-arid environments, making it a resilient species in harsh conditions.
